summary: In the show verse, I have a head canon that Cersei didn’t tell Tywin they had lost Arya until he arrived at the capital (because...
body:
In the show verse, I have a head canon that Cersei didn’t tell Tywin they had lost Arya until he arrived at the capital (because yeah, I wouldn’t want to admit I’d lost a valuable hostage to my scary dad either), which is the primary reason he didn’t guess that Arya was his cupbearer.

But I ADDITIONALLY have a head canon that as soon as Cersei told Tywin about the missing Stark daughter that he flashed back to his cup bearer who could read, had a dead father, was clearly hiding something/was on the run and spoke like a noble girl and went “Ah, fuck. That was her”.

reblog.comment:

summary: “This Thoros,” Gendry said as they walked past the kennels, “is he the same Thoros who lived in the castle at King’s Landing? A...
text:
“This Thoros,” Gendry said as they walked past the kennels, “is he the same Thoros who lived in the castle at King’s Landing? A red priest, fat, with a shaved head?”

“I think so.” Arya had never spoken to Thoros at King’s Landing that she could recall, but she knew who he was. He and Jalabhar Xho had been the most colorful figures at Robert’s court, and Thoros was a great friend of the king as well.

“He won’t remember me, but he used to come to our forge.” The Smallwood forge had not been used in some time, though the smith had hung his tools neatly on the wall. Gendry lit a candle and set it on the anvil while he took down a pair of tongs. “My master always scolded him about his flaming swords. It was no way to treat good steel, he’d say, but this Thoros never used good steel. He’d just dip some cheap sword in wildfire and set it alight. It was only an alchemist’s trick, my master said, but it scared the horses and some of the greener knights.”

She screwed up her face, trying to remember if her father had ever talked about Thoros. “He isn’t very priestly, is he?”
“No,” Gendry admitted. “Master Mott said Thoros could outdrink even King Robert. They were pease in a pod, he told me, both gluttons and sots.”

“You shouldn’t call the king a sot.” Maybe King Robert had drunk a lot, but he’d been her father’s friend.
“I was talking about Thoros.” Gendry reached out with the tongs as if to pinch her face, but Arya swatted them away.

summary: Game of Thrones: 9 Changes That Improved on the Books
title: Game of Thrones: 9 Changes That Improved on the Books
excerpt: Despite book purists' often sweeping generalizations, there have been some book changes in Game of Thrones that were for the better.
description:
Game of Thrones season 8 is upon us, dear friends. And with its mostly triumphant arrival, the familiar anxieties return. What if it is not as good as what came before? How are they going to satisfyingly tell this part of the story–the final part, no less–in only a handful of episodes? Will Jon Snow ever learn the truth of his parentage?! And what exactly did showrunners David Benioff and D.B. Weiss get wrong last season?

Aye, even as Game of Thrones becomes a bigger cultural juggernaut with each passing season, literary fans of George R.R. Martin’s “A Song of Ice and Fire” source material also become more vocal in their condemnation of HBO’s adaptation. And they’re of course not often wrong. As a fellow traveler of Sullied book readers, I too cannot help but notice when some changes leave something to be desired on the television series… 

[Read More]

summary: Arya + Wolf Monikers (Requested by @insomniarama​) She was no little girl in the dream; she was a wolf, huge and powerful, and...
caption:
Arya + Wolf Monikers (Requested by @insomniarama​)

She was no little girl in the dream; she was a wolf, huge and powerful, and when she emerged from beneath the trees in front of them and bared her teeth in a low rumbling growl, she could smell the rank stench of fear from horse and man alike.

blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary: I love how Gendry and Arya are each other’s only possible love interests. When Joe and Maisie talk about love or anything close...
body: I love how Gendry and Arya are each other’s only possible love interests. When Joe and Maisie talk about love or anything close to that everyone immeditely assumes it’s about gendrya. Gendry is the only boy for Arya and Arya is the only girl for Gendry. They have no competition at all. It’s either them or nothing. Even people who don’t ship it can’t deny that they belong together and that they wouldn’t make sense with anyone else. And there’s really no other couple/ship on got that has got that going for them.
